I notice this does not yet cover the Linux Ext-4 formatting , and I guess I'm surprised that Acronis has not caught up with that as it has been out for some time.  Not a problem of course, as an open source partitioner will do it.

@cojon

There really isn't much reason to add that filetype, could you just make a fat32 partition and tell your Distro to install on there?  It'll automatically convert to an ext-4 format.
